meanings.definition: The plural form of 'caph', meaning a small, pointed piece of land jutting into the sea.
meanings.sent1: The caphs along the coast provided a beautiful view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen set up their nets near the caphs to catch fish.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls loved to perch on the caphs and watch the waves.
meanings.sent4: The caphs stood like sentinels guarding the entrance to the bay.
meanings.sent5: The caphs looked like tiny fingers reaching out into the water.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'caph', meaning to capture or seize.
meanings.sent1: He caphs the opportunity to learn something new every day.
meanings.sent2: She always caphs the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat caphs the toy mouse and proudly parades around with it.
meanings.sent4: The spider caphs its prey in a delicate web of silk.
meanings.sent5: The detective caphs the criminal after a long chase through the city.

meanings.definition: The past tense form of the verb 'caph', meaning to take or grab forcefully.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she caphs the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent2: He caphs the opportunity to show off his new skills.
meanings.sent3: The child caphs the chance to play with the shiny new toy.
meanings.sent4: The thief caphs the bag and disappears into the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The storm caphs the umbrella from her hands and carries it away.
